title: 1 Killed, 3 Wounded In West Side Shooting
content:
CHICAGO (CBS) — Chicago Police say a man was killed and a woman gravely injured in a shooting this morning in West Garfield Park.
The man killed was 24 years old, police say. Shot in the chest.
Four people shot in all – just west of Garfield Park in the 100 block of South Springfield – about 4:35 this morning.
A 21-year-old woman was shot in the chest and back – and police describe her condition as grave.
A 23-year-old woman shot in both feet. She’s in stable condition at Mount Sinai Hospital.
Another woman – a 20-year-old – had a graze wound to the leg.
Police say the victims were on a sidewalk and two men approached on foot and opened fire with handguns.
Police say no one is in custody.
